 083: # def create_hole_hopping_operator_ij_tJmodel(int i, int j, int sigma, int N_sites, np.ndarray[uint32_t, ndim=1] states):
 084: #     # a_i^\dagger a_j (for spin sigma = 0 or 1)
 085: #     cdef uint32_t D, c=0
 086: #     cdef uint32_t ni, nj, nibar, njbar, phase, fermions_in_between, low, high
 087: #     cdef uint32_t idx=0, idx2=0, mask, state2, state
 088: 
 089: #     D = len(states)
 090: #     row = np.zeros(D, dtype = np.uint64)
 091: #     col = np.zeros(D, dtype = np.uint64)
 092: #     data = np.zeros(D, dtype = np.float64)
 093: 
 094: #     c = 0     # counter
 095: #     i = i + (1-sigma)*N_sites
 096: #     j = j + (1-sigma)*N_sites
 097: 
 098: 
 099: #     if i == j:
 100: #         for idx in range(D):
 101: #             state = states[idx]
 102: #             #Op[idx, idx] += ni
 103: #             row[c] = idx
 104: #             col[c] = idx
 105: #             data[c] = get_bit_j_fast(state, j)
 106: #             c += 1
 107: #     else:
 108: # #         low, high = (i,j) if (i<=j) else (j,i) 
 109: # #         mask = (1<<(high+1) - 1) - (1<<(low+1) - 1)
 110: #         mask = (1<<(j+1) - 1) - (1<<(i+1) - 1)
 111: #         for idx in range(D):
 112: #             state = states[idx]
 113: #             # assume i<=j
 114: #             # if i > j, then use transpose, dont recalculate
 115: 
 116: #             ni = get_bit_j_fast(state, i)
 117: #             nj = get_bit_j_fast(state, j)
 118: 
 119: 
 120: #             nibar = get_bit_j_fast(state, i+(2*sigma-1)*N_sites)
 121: #             njbar = get_bit_j_fast(state, j+(2*sigma-1)*N_sites)
 122: 
 123: #             if (ni == 0 and nj == 1) and (nibar == 0 and njbar == 0):
 124: #                 fermions_in_between = count_1s(state & mask)
 125: 
 126: #                 phase = 1 - 2 * (fermions_in_between % 2)
 127: #                 state2 = flip_bit2_fast(state, i, j)
 128: #                 idx2 = find_state(state2, states)
 129: 
 130: #                 row[c] = idx2
 131: #                 col[c] = idx
 132: #                 data[c] = phase
 133: #                 c += 1
 134: # #             else:# do nothing
 135: # #                 print("rejected: ", ni, nj, nibar, njbar)
 136: 
 137: #     # print(c)
 138: #     Op = coo_matrix((data[:c+1], (row[:c+1], col[:c+1])), shape = (D, D), dtype = np.float64)
 139: #     Opcsr = Op.tocsr()
 140: #     return Opcsr
